forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 52. South southwest wind 6 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock strikes a new day in Downtown San Francisco, tonight’s skies have settled into a comfortable pairing of clouds under a gentle breeze. The temperatures dip slightly to embrace a cool low of 52, granting a crisp edge that invites the night air to mingle with the warmth of the lingering day. A light south-southwest wind whispers through the streets, carrying with it hints of the bay, while the stars begin to peek through the remnants of a gentle marine layer that adds a touch of mystery to the night scenery.

As dawn breaks and the sun arcs into the sky, expect a transformation into a bright, sunny canvas. The day will warm steadily, reaching a high near 66, only to soften slightly to a more moderate 62 as afternoon settles in. With the gentle southwest wind rising to 14 mph and possibly gusting up to 20, you might feel the playful nudge of the breeze against your skin, reminiscent of a summer’s dance along the coast. 

Dressing for the day will require layers—a light jacket to ward off the cool air of the early morning, shedding it as the sun stretches its golden arms. Perhaps you’ll find joy in a peaceful stroll along the waterfront, savoring a warm cup of coffee while contemplating the golden hue reflecting off the water. Or, delve into the engaging arts scene scattered throughout the city, where an afternoon visit to a gallery or museum can offer a delightful escape. Whether it’s exploring hidden cafes or simply enjoying the scenery, today is poised to be an inviting tapestry, perfect for both contemplation and quiet adventure.
